definition: to combine/to join/to unite/alliance/same as 聯合|联合
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: Joints are defined as a union between one bone and another.
sentences.chinese: 關節是指一個骨與另一個骨之間的連合。

sentences.english: So all the men of Israel got together and united as one man against the city.
sentences.chinese: 於是以色列衆人彼此連合如同一人，聚集攻擊那城。

sentences.english: The carpel closed toward and connected with the ovary central column to form axile placentation since mid October.
sentences.chinese: 十月中旬起心皮向內合生並與中軸連合形成中軸胎座。

definition: a guild/(in olden times) an association such as a political party, religious group or trade guild/the Japanese word for company
to complete a course of study (old)/to graduate
preparedness/to bring sth to a state of readiness
Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan
